title: Drawing, "Design for a Curtain, Beth Am Synagogue, Los Altos, California", 1968–69
medium: Cut paper, brush and gouache, crayon, gold and silver paper, overlaid with cellophane
signed: Signed in graphite on old mat below lower right corner of drawing:  T Guermonprez '68; beneath lower left corner of drawing:  M I.
inscribed: Inscribed in blue ink on white label on verso of mat, lower right, :  Curtain for tempel [sic]/ "Beth Am" Los Altos/silk/double cloth/1968 (beneath text at left); M.I. (beneath text at right).
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: On a crimson, blue and gold vertically-stripped background, a large seven-branched menorah.  In the space on either side of the central branch, five hebrew letters [referring to the ten commandments?].  Beneath the first arm of the candelabrum, a Hebrew word [to be translated].  Two horizontal crimson stripes run across the curtain about 1/4 up from the bottom.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a Curtain, Beth Am Synagogue, Los Altos, California", 1968–69.Cut paper, brush and gouache, crayon, gold and silver paper, overlaid with cellophane. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-70.
